docs.snippet: To-morrow the City Inspector is to open the proposals for cleaning the streets, avenues, , of the City for the term of five years. Bids have been invited by public advertisement for some weeks past,--specifications were prepared ...
docs.lead_paragraph: To-morrow the City Inspector is to open the proposals for cleaning the streets, avenues, , of the City for the term of five years. Bids have been invited by public advertisement for some weeks past,--specifications were prepared ...

headline.main: THE HEALTH OF NEW-YORK.; Excess of Mortality in this City--What Causes it, and How it may be Remedied. INTERESTING REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE OF THE STATE ASSEMBLY. CAUSES OF EXCESSIVE MORTALITY. HEALTH ARRANGEMENTS OF NEW-YORK AND BROOKLYN. OPINIONS OF THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES. PECUNIARY AND MORAL ECONOMY OF HEALTH MEASURES. THE IMPORTANCE TO THE STATE AND COUNTRY OF A SOUND CONDITION OF HEALTH IN THE DISTRICT. QUARANTINE. ASIATIC CHOLERA.

docs.snippet: No tribute of respect to the memory of the greatest of American historians could have been more appropriate, or have emanated from a more fitting source, than that offered last evening by the NewYork Historical Society.

headline.main: WASHINGTON IRVING.; Commemoration of the Birth and Death of the Great Historian. Eulogy Delivered Before the New-York Historical Society by William Cullen Bryant.

docs.lead_paragraph: No tribute of respect to the memory of the greatest of American historians could have been more appropriate, or have emanated from a more fitting source, than that offered last evening by the NewYork Historical Society.

docs.snippet: The association known as "The Marine Temperance Society of the Port of New-York," held its twenty-seventh meeting last evening in the Mariner's Church, corner of Catharine and Madison streets. The assemblage was rather a meagre one, and of the...

headline.main: Marine Temperance Society.; TWENTY-SEVENTH ANNUAL MEETING.

docs.lead_paragraph: The association known as "The Marine Temperance Society of the Port of New-York," held its twenty-seventh meeting last evening in the Mariner's Church, corner of Catharine and Madison streets. The assemblage was rather a meagre one, and of the persons present hardly a tithe seemed to be seafaring men. Capt. EDWARD RICHARDSON, who is the President, occupied the Chair.

docs.snippet: The semi-annual session of the Third Presbytery of New-York (New School) commenced in this City yesterday, at the Mercer-street Presbyterian Church. About forty members were present, twothirds of whom were ministers.

headline.main: Third Presbytery of New-York.; SEMI-ANNUAL SESSION AT THE MERCER-STREET CHURCH.

docs.lead_paragraph: The semi-annual session of the Third Presbytery of New-York (New School) commenced in this City yesterday, at the Mercer-street Presbyterian Church. About forty members were present, twothirds of whom were ministers.

byline.original: Special Dispatch to the New-York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Monday, April 2. INDIAN AFFAIRS.  The annuity goods for the Indians in the Eastern District of Washington Territory will be dispatched over Lieut. MULLAN'S new wagon road, and distributed at Hellgate.

headline.main: FROM WASHINGTON.; Debate on the Davis Resolutions in the Senate. Interesting Remarks of Messrs. Saulsbury, Ten Eyck, Brown and Wigfall. The House upon the Utah Saints and their Sins.

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Monday, April 2. INDIAN AFFAIRS. The annuity goods for the Indians in the Eastern District of Washington Territory will be dispatched over Lieut. MULLAN'S new wagon road, and distributed at Hellgate.
